column2: The MAX command returns the maximum (highest) value in a specified column.
column3: The MIN command returns the minimum (lowest) value in a specified column.
column4: The AVG command is used to calculate the average (mean) of all values in a specified column.
column5: The SUM command is used to calculate the sum of all values in a specified column.
column6: The COUNT command counts the number of rows or non-null values in a specified column.
column9: The ALL command is used to compare a value to all values returned by a subquery. It can be used with comparison operators like =, >, <, etc.
column10: The ANY command is used to compare a value to any value returned by a subquery. It can be used with comparison operators like =, >, <, etc.
column11: The IN command is used to determine whether a value matches any value in a subquery result. It is often used in the WHERE clause.

column9: SELECT column(s) FROM table WHERE value > ALL (subquery);
column10: SELECT column(s) FROM table WHERE value < ANY (subquery);
column11: SELECT column(s) FROM table WHERE value IN (subquery);

column9: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_amount > ALL (SELECT total_amount FROM previous_orders);
column10: SELECT * FROM products WHERE price < ANY (SELECT unit_price FROM supplier_products);
column11: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE city IN (SELECT city FROM suppliers);
